author: wsjcom
title: Closed Minds Have No Place in Universities
text:
Regarding Amy Wax’s “The Closing of the Academic Mind” (Review, Feb. 17): The trend of free speech being curtailed on college campuses is alarming and disturbing. We need dissent. We need substantive arguments about divisive issues. We need persuasion from all sides, and we most expect it when being educated.
In college, the best learning experience I had was in debate. The process involves gathering evidence to support both sides of a resolution. During tournaments, you present and rebut the “negative” and “affirmative.”...
